tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE adventure_experiences (
    experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experience_name VARCHAR(255),
    user_id INT,
    user_review TEXT,
    user_rating FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE adventure_experiences (
    experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experience_name VARCHAR,
    location VARCHAR,
    rating FLOAT,
    user_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE user_reviews (
    review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    experience_id INT,
    review_text TEXT,
    rating FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE user_reviews (
  review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT NOT NULL,
  experience_id INT NOT NULL,
  review_text TEXT,
  rating FLOAT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE AdventureTravelExperiences (
    experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experience_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    category VARCHAR(50),
    experience_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Reviews (
    review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    experience_id INT,
    rating INT,
    review_text TEXT,
    review_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES Users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (experience_id) REFERENCES AdventureTravelExperiences(experience_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Recommendations (
    recommendation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    recommended_experience_id INT,
    recommendation_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES Users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (recommended_experience_id) REFERENCES AdventureTravelExperiences(experience_id)
);

CREATE TABLE user_reviews (
  review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT NOT NULL,
  experience_id INT NOT NULL,
  rating FLOAT NOT NULL,
  comments TEXT,
  review_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE adventure_experiences (
  experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  experience_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  price DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL
);
